data.text: @AlastairMcA30 It's the science journals that are beating the dead horse. I have no interest in whether iv works or not. But don't blame people who read what journals print. It's not like we're taking cues from The Enquirer.

@comilla_s @AlastairMcA30 @nickmmark As someone who has family members who are pro ivermectin (I have not been convinced since there are so many retractions and flawed studies), I’m wondering what the solve would be for flawed studies being published? I thought peer review was the solve?

@AlastairMcA30 @nickmmark This is the problem with peer review. It should not have been printed in the first place. A statement of concern or a retraction, will not undo the harm which has already been done by printing this. The “concern” and retraction never get the same level of publicity as original.
@AlastairMcA30 Just a friendly reminder that pronoun users don’t have much credibility especially when they blindly believe the globalists propaganda.
@oopsadaisy64 No, it has not. I will not tolerate this misinformation on my TL. Goodbye.
@AlastairMcA30 😆 I see that you did there !
